The **Office of the Controller General of Accounts** (CGA) is an autonomous government agency in Bangladesh, headquartered in Dhaka, tasked with compiling and consolidating government financial accounts. Established in 1985, it succeeded the Office of the Accountant General, which was founded in 1947, and oversees tax collection by the National Board of Revenue. The CGA has faced allegations of corruption, with 23 specific incidents documented by Transparency International Bangladesh, and occasionally collaborates with the Office of the Comptroller and Auditor General for oversight. Its role is critical in ensuring fiscal accountability and transparency in public financial management.
